https://prez.dev/description.@value: The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operatorâ€™s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Waterflooding or water injection is where water is injected into the oil reservoir, to maintain the pressure (also known as voidage replacement) or to drive oil towards the wells, and thereby increase production. Water-injection wells are common offshore, where filtered and treated seawater is injected into a lower water-bearing section of the reservoir. The concept includes water recharge of aquifers.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Waterflooding or water injection is where water is injected into the oil reservoir, to maintain the pressure (also known as voidage replacement) or to drive oil towards the wells, and thereby increase production. Water-injection wells are common offshore, where filtered and treated seawater is injected into a lower water-bearing section of the reservoir. The concept includes water recharge of aquifers.
